channel.title: Sambhav Singh Rohatgi
channel.description: Recent content on Sambhav Singh Rohatgi

item.title: Week 1 - Select an idea
item.description: What is this? # This is my first week of building barbershop AI, an app to try out different hairstyles virtually. The motive of the first week was to select an idea and this is the one I landed on.

item.title: Part 1: Hosting your custom MLflow server on GCP VM
item.description: Motive # MLflow is a popular library for experiment tracking for Machine Learning. In addition to experiment tracking, it also offers a model registery and tracking platform. MLFlow can be used with a local database and artifact store, this is usually good enough for running experiments personally.

item.title: YOLO V4
item.description: These are notes for my reading of the YOLO v5 paper. Check out the orignal paper at the link below YOLO v4 -- High Level # They create a CNN that operates in real time on a conventional GPU and can be trained on a single GPU as well.

item.title: DBSCAN clustering and reverse geocoding for geospatial data
item.description: Motive # The motive of the following post is to take a look at how to cluster geospatial data using the Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications with Noise (DBSCAN) algorithm.

item.title: Segment Anything
item.description: These are notes for my reading of the segment anything paper. Check out the orignal project page by Meta AI at the link below Segment Anything by Meta AI High Level # Main idea behind the model is to build a foundational model for Computer Vision similar to the state of the NLP community + allow it to be promptable.

item.title: Using Radar Plots to Compare Model Performance
item.description: Motive # Does looking at a table comparing model peformance across multiple metrics feel bothersome to you? Lets see how radar plots can help us quickly visually compare model performance across multiple metrics.
